body.p: The IFRIC observed that paragraph 32 of IAS 29 states:

lq.p: The restatement of financial statements in accordance with this Standard may give rise to differences between the carrying amount of individual assets and liabilities in the balance sheet and their tax bases. These differences are accounted for in accordance with IAS 12 Income Taxes.

body.p: Therefore, at the closing balance sheet date of the reporting period an entity remeasures its deferred tax items on the basis of the restated financial statements, rather than by applying the general restatement provisions for monetary items or non‑monetary items. However, the IFRIC noted that it was not clear how an entity should account for its comparative deferred tax items.
